Reviews.Title: “My Seattle home!”
Reviews.Author: Jeslaf
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in several other airport hotels in the area (some Hilton, some Marriott family names) and this is by far the BEST. Super location right off 405, but minutes to I-5 and airport, as well as South Center mall, which the hotel shuttle will gladly take you to for shopping and dining options. Hotel shuttle also took us to return rental car the night before it was due to avoid rushing in the morning. Rooms are GORGEOUS, clean, and beautifully decorated with full kitchens including everything one needs to set up house: utensils, dinnerware, even dishtowels/potholders. Property has beautiful landscaping and HOT breakfast all days AND DINNER with beer/wine on weekdays. I'm talking FULL, hot dinner with free drinks. Fireplace and flatscreen inside, quaint table seating on patio weather permitting. Staff is SUPER friendly, and we've dealt with folks mid day, late night, and 4 a.m. Can't beat this place. We'll never go anywhere else when we're flying in/out of Seattle, and it's so good, we stay here even while touring Seattle/Tacoma attractions during our trip. We're pleasure travelers, but the mainly business clientele seem to feel the same way, and there are always a few families with kids sprinkled into the mix. HIGHLY recommended.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: hvan5
Reviews.Content: Overall a good place to stay. The room was spacious,clean and had the amenitites we needed. For the facility itseld there is not much to speak about other than the breakfast was good as it had a good selection of both hot and cold items to choose from. The time of being closed at 9 for breakfast seemed a bit early because if you are on holidays you might not want to get up early to go and eat. The pool and hot tub were really nothing to speak of cause both were small and outdoors so if you were wnating to enjoy a soak or swim and the weather was fool it did not make for a great experience. The staff were great and friendly and were always willing to do what they could for us even upgrading us when our phone in reservation was messed up by Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “They treated me well.”
Reviews.Author: chris k
Reviews.Content: I was traveling for business, and staying for 2 months. The staff treated me very well during my extended stay. The hotel offers a great shuttle service. They were able to get me to my training, local shopping and food. The front desk staff of Melissa, Shemekia and Mike were a great help to me. They gave me a few great options for food and entertainment. Mike even was able to get me signed up for the Hilton Honors program. All in all this was a great place. If I am every back to the Seattle area, I will choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: bflip
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. Nice clean and comfortable rooms. Above average "free" breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: bergroup
Reviews.Content: Recently spent two weeks in the Pacific Northwest and stayed at The Homewood Suites. I am a Diamond level Honors member so I always try to pick a Hilton property when traveling on business. The hotel is a short 7 minute drive from SeaTac......unless you hit rush hours!! Seattle traffic is miserable and it could take up to 30-40 minutes during the evening rush. If coming from the airport during the evening rush I suggest taking International Drive north to Southcenter Drive. This detour will save you plenty of time and aggravation. The hotel sits in a park-like setting with all of the rooms occupying 5 or 6 out buildings. There is no airport noise and the rooms are generally quiet. The suites are large and well appointed with a full size 'fridge, stove and sink. Not too much to add that hasn't already been stated so I will move on to the only complaint I have about this property......the Internet. Both the wired and wireless access to the internet is horrific at best. This is a MAJOR pet peeve of mine. In the past year I have frequented many hotels (Hilton and others) who claim to provide free "high-speed" internet when the truth is that it is slower than a dial-up connection. I used Speed Test dot net to test the speed and repeatedly recorded download speeds in the .25-.35 MBPS range. I would rather the hotel not offer internet rather than be subjected to inferior results. The staff was awesome, especially the hostess's at the nightly dinner buffet. With the exception of the baked potato's and chili, the nightly offerings were delightful. All in all, a very nice property. I will return if my business takes me to the Seattle area again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: MaMa6363
Reviews.Content: This place was perfect for my family of 5. very spacious and clean. we had to check in because our electricity was out due to that ice storm we had so the full kitchen was great. it had moat of the things we needed and if it didn't, the front dear staff was happy to provide. the staff was also very friendly and helpful. They do have a shuttle on request to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: jgl1
Reviews.Content: We were so impressed by the rooms, the amenities and the cheerful and helpful personnel at the Homewood Suites that we'd definitely stay here again and start using this chain.

Reviews.Title: “Sold me on this Brand”
Reviews.Author: majorbidamon
Reviews.Content: This was my first experience with this chain. It was so good, I switched from Holiday Inn over to Hilton brand hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelMel1
Reviews.Content: My husband and stayed here for a night on our recent trip to the Seattle/Portland Area. This was a great hotel. The area was very quiet for being so close to the airport and the rooms were very spacious and clean. The bathroom area was awesome for two people trying to get ready at the same time as the double sinks sat outside of the shower area. The full kitchen is alway nice at the Homewood Suites and there is plenty of room to relax and unwind. The beds were very comfortable and we had a great night's sleep. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Coffee was available in the lobby all day. We had the complimentary breakfast before starting out the next morning. It was very good and there was a large selection of hot food, bagels, toast, oatmeal, cold cereals, juices and coffee. Definitely a nice start to the day. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are in the area. We also stayed at the Hampton Inn and Suites by the Sea-Tac Airport on this trip. The Homewood Suites was far superior to the Hampton Inn and only slightly more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Older property, but well maintained”
Reviews.Author: irah
Reviews.Content: As stated, we found this to be a little older property, but its location is nice and close to the airport. We stayed only one night on our way back home. Its about 25-35 minutes from downtown depending on traffic. Pros: Free managers evening reception (Mon through Thur) Complimentary breakfast (all days) Free parking Cons: A little older hotel We got a high-floor room and found that the floor would creak in certain areas We would definitely consider staying here again, if we revisited Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: the4taals
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before we left Seattle for our Alaskan cruise. We few in late, the shuttle was there very fast to pick us up. The suite was spacious and awesome! Front desk offered suggestions for ordering in, shuttle took my husband to pick up beverages and snacks. Breakfast was excellent, many selections ans constantly refilling, the hotel was very busy. Would definitely stay again at a Homewood Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Kind of Hidden”
Reviews.Author: jtraveler23
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here. The hotel rooms are modern and very clean. All of the staff was very friendly. Located close to the mall and airport. The immediate area was very quite as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms but Very Poor Management”
Reviews.Author: jes4317
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel the night before our Alaskan Cruise and one night after our cruise. We are very loyal to Homewood Suites and until now have never had a problem. They have always been well managed and a great value. This Hotel was a huge let down from our previous experiences with Homewood Suites. The first night was ok, but the manager acted as though we did not have a reservation by saying here is what we have left. We made reservations for both nights far in advance. Then came our second night's stay and I don't know where to begin. The problems started at checkin. We were early as we had no control over when we left our ship. We arrived at the hotel at around 1:00 pm and were told no rooms were available yet. When I asked how long it would take to get a roome ready for us I was rudely told "Check-in time is 3:00. No offer was made to try to accomodate us. Again acting a though we did not have a reservation we were told here is what we have left. When we arrived back at the hotel at around 3:00 the room was ready, but not what we had reserved. It was 2 double beds. We reserved a king bed room. The hinge on diswasher was broken and the door almost fell off when we first opened it. The clock in the bedroom didn't seem to be lit so you could see the time at night. They overcharged us for the room saying it was an upgrade, although we were not informed of this up front. They did refund the difference after my wife complained and showed them our reservation amount. The topper was when we went to our car the next morning, we found a note stating we were parked illegally and our car was going to be towed, because we were never provided a card to put on our dashboard. When we brought up all of the problems we had with the management of the hotel they did offer to refund our second night's stay. We presume they will honor their offer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice is you want something close to airport”
Reviews.Author: Anusinghs
Reviews.Content: Close to seattle airport... incase u want to stay somewhere close to Renton.. this is a good option.. lot of places to eat nearby and South center mall as well... About 15 mins drive from Seattle downtown

Reviews.Title: “Good place for family in Seattle area”
Reviews.Author: Bigkahunaiii
Reviews.Content: We travel with our two adult children. The two bedroom site was perfect for us. The location is not optimum for sightseeing in Seattle, especially give the area's almost constant traffic slow downs. But closer in hotels did not have appropriate bed sizes...we're tall people. Room really nice. Each bedroom has it's now en suite bath. Free breakfast and dinner (with wine and local craft brew beer) Monday through Thursday a definite benefit for a family of four.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: ElaineG29
Reviews.Content: As always, a great value at Homewood Suites. The kids always love the serve yourself breakfast with waffles, eggs and hot food as well as cold cereals and rolls and my young teen in particular loves to make her own iced coffees with the premium creamers, etc. There were a few really nice things about this particular stay and a few challenges. The Good: Always a great price for dependable xtras... a good pool, evening food, morning breakfast, good coffee, kitchen in the room, quietness, beautiful grounds with private feel of entrances with the building design and arrangements. Beds were pretty comfortable and my husband and I good a good sleep. Front desk was friendly and check in and out were efficient. The walking path was a-w-e-s-o-m-e. My husband and I walked far every evening, past light industrial area, across the river, soccer fields, parks, etc. Safe and well maintained paved path. A lot of other bike rides and walkers; it was quite nice and didn't hurt that the weather was perfect. The ok: There were a lot of young adults staying when we were there for a week. They were outside the pool, in the pool, doing a lot of drinking, etc. They were not drunk or unruly but there was a lot of profanity I would have prefered my 8 year old NOT hear rather than hear. Still, not too big a deal. Oh, and the Jacuzzi wasn't closed, but it wasn't getting above luke-warm. And thelaundry was useful but the partying guys that were there didn't always come get their wash when it was done so there was a lot of waiting for someone to move their stuff. The unfortunate: When we got there the first night we pulled out the sofa sleeper for the kids. It was dirty... It looked like someone had eated a crunchy chocolate chip cookie on the sheets, and the mattress pad was older than the one my great grandma used to use on her guest bed -- didn't even fit over the matress actually. I called the front desk and they said they did not have rollaway beds, but they would send someone to change the sheets. We had to check a few times with the front desk throughout the evening until Housekeeping finally came. They did change the sheets and pad, but not much they could do with the sad mattress that really needs to be replaced... very worn, thin and lumpy. I asked if we could move to a larger room or even rent an additional room with an adequate bed but apparently they were all sold out every night that week we were staying. My daughter slept in the livingroom chair for that week. The front desk clerk called and spoke to my husband later that night and offerend a $25 credit as an apology for each night we had booked there, which was nice but it never showed up on our bill or on our credit card. I'd probably stay there again if the price was right, but would either get a two bedroom or two- 1 bedroom suites next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Large and Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MSUEngineer
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel very nice and spacious. Bedding was very comfortable and the suite was well equipped and spacious. The hotel provided a free shuttle from the airport (where we dropped off a rental car), to and from a nearby restaurant, and again the next morning to the airport. Contrary to another review, we found the shuttle service excellent and very quick. Breakfast, as with other Homewood Suites, was good with plenty of variety. Highly recommended for close accomodations near Sea-Tac Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Claude C
Reviews.Content: Nice property, close to the airport and very close to a huge shopping mall with all the shops and great restaurants. Make sure you ask for rooms not facing the railroad tracks!! Staff was perfect, so was the breakfast and the free internet connection

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: antiquelover611
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent a week in this hotel while vacationing in Seattle. We found the property to be attractive, well-kept, and conveniently located. Our suite was clean and comfortable. Noting the complaints about the trains in other reviews, we requested and received a quiet room. We heard no train noise at all, and I am a light sleeper! We enjoyed the paved walking trail in back of the hotel. The daily breakfast was good. We were only able to take advantage of the complementary dinner one night, and it was simple but adequate. The staff seemed surprisingly uninformed about local attractions, but were helpful with providing computer printouts, etc. This property is located in an office park and is convenient to the airport, train station, and light rail station. Mt. Rainier Nat'l. Park is a good day trip to make from here. There is a very nice mall nearby as well, with several good stores and restaurants. This is a well-maintained hotel and I would recommend it to anyone visiting Seattle who does not want to stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room, Convenient to Airport”
Reviews.Author: katt51
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite while visiting the Seattle area. It was immaculate, quiet and very comfortable. The kitchen was nicely equipped with dishwasher & microwave but no oven. Living area had a fireplace w/dura log. I was surprised that the table only had 2 chairs - you would think such a large unit would mean more than 2 guests. Breakfast was fine - nice variety and food was good. If we are in the Seattle area, we'd definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Traveling alot in the past few months, definite home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Sabatino0
Reviews.Content: My first experience at a Homewood Hilton, and I have to admit I was floored with the home like warm feel of the hotel. Room was spacious and I didn't feel like I was in a cracker jack box. Was able to spread my work out, and make myself comfortable. Long hours for work make it difficult to pry myself out of bed in the morning but the hot breakfast was delightful and I was pleased. Staff was great, smiled and welcomed me. Will spend time in Tukwila every so often for work, although I will not frequent the area I will stay here each and every time.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: btorneby
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at this property. I was impressed with the home like feel. The light dinner was a nice surprise. The housekeeping staff was very good at their work, 20 minutes and my suites was better then new! I did experience a small problem of my own doing, however the desk staff person (Mike) was able to help me find a solution and was very helpful. I look forward to my next vists and will be staying here again, for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite airport 'overnighter'”
Reviews.Author: samjust08
Reviews.Content: Living in Bellingham, WA we usually book flights out of SEATAC in the morning and spend the night nearby before the flight. I've spend a fortune staying 'at' the airport, just for the luxury of being across the street. Once we found the Homewood suites in Tukwila, we stopped staying at the airport. Its barely ten minutes away. 1) You get 3 to 4 times the amount of room for your buck, in space and comfort compared to airport hotels. 2) The shuttle service is great if you need it. 3) The rooms are clean and the staff are friendly. 4) The rates are actually quite reasonable for what you get. If you want a low budget motel experience, there are plenty available in the area. This is not a luxury hotel. It's a typical business travelers all suites property, and its worth every penny, even though I could live without the typical heartburn inducing lobby breakfast and the train noise. As to security, I've stayed there at least a dozen times over the last couple of years and have never had any problems whatsoever, nor have I met anyone who has, though I'm sure it happens. It happens everywhere. I would say that 8 out of 10 times I've been able to park my car within 50 ft of our room when staying in a ground floor unit (which I always request). I highly recommend this property. Just make sure you book in advance for better rates.

Reviews.Title: “Use to be Better”
Reviews.Author: bleifuss
Reviews.Content: Homewood Suites Tukwila was always my favorite place to stay when visiting the Seattle area; however, their rates have skyrocketed over the past several years which forced me to find cheaper accommodations. Beautiful atmosphere, great freebie food for breakfast and in the evening, spacious suites, and if you're lucky to have a room facing the 405, you *might* get to see Mt. Rainier in all its glory on a sunny day. Highly recommend, if you don't mind paying alot more for a room than is necessary; there are other nice places in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and enjoy soccer”
Reviews.Author: SoccerUp
Reviews.Content: Booked 2- 1 bedroom suites for my family and another that came up to play in a soccer tournament at Star Fire. I read the reviews and was a little tentative. If you read the worst reviews, I can address most of them. The staff here is awsome, helpfull and friendly. Took care of any problem or possible problems I had, beyond my expectations. Thank you to Kellie and Mike.. The location is on the green river with railroad tracks on the other side of it. The trains came through but the noise inside was minimum and any rumble barely noticed. The rooms are well insulated and the annoyance was minimal at best. The parking lot had no cars broken into while I was there. I walked around and looked for glass on the ground and found none. Any public parking lot has its share of problems. The fireplace is for ambience and the fire log was great. The rooms have central air heating so the room was always comfortable. The kids outside running around were mine and the ones that were not were respectfull and well behaved. I slept like a log on my king size bed. Good breakfast So if you are a parent and have a child that plays soccer this is heaven. You can walk right out to the largest soccer center in the area, Star Fire. Would have liked to stay longer. The rooms are set up like a condo/apartment and quite well appointed. The ones we stayed in were courtyard style The parking lot is about 100 feet from the furthest most rooms so not that long of a haul unless your over 70 and the handicap parking is about 50 feet so should not be a problem. Wifi loaded quickly and was standard G wifi. Not N. No problems getting on the net. My friends, that stayed in the room next door to us, agreed with my evaluation.

Reviews.Title: “Great home comfort”
Reviews.Author: cach23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a restful area that feels more like a comfortable small condo complex rather than a business. The breakfast was great and the rooms are clean and plenty spacious. The hotel is convenient to the airport, the highway, and shopping but still quiet and relaxing. This place was really a great place to come home to after a busy day and I love having a kitchen. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overcharged for stay”
Reviews.Author: kooslubbe
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a month at Homewood Suites Tukwila, i had from the first week problems with my account, they charged my credit card for two rooms, on enquiry they told me they will fix the problem. They fix it so good that my account ended up in a minus $777. It took me 3 days to get it solved. On the day before check out i asked them settle my account in full. They have told me it`s not a problem, they will only deduct the outstanding amount. The Friday before departure back to South Africa i checked my account and realised my card were overcharged by $111.27. I went back to reception and they told me my credit card will be credited within 2 days. Untill present i did not received any money back from them, i`ve written several E-mails to them and don`t get any respond from them. You can`t complain about customer care because there`s nothing when you depart back to your home country. My company did make regular use of Homewood Suites and after this incident i will recommend to them never to make use of Homewood Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Train Noise”
Reviews.Author: RussVancouver
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really quite nice in all respects, except I had a 2 bedroom suite in the back and there are train tracks within a hundred yards or so. I paid $249 for the suite, which would have been fine, except a train goes by about every 1/2 hour. The trains didn't blow their horns at night, but it still resulted in a disturbed sleep. Had a nice free buffet breakfast as well. So only stay here if you have a quiet room in the front.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for train spotters, horrible for light sleepers”
Reviews.Author: VGABND
Reviews.Content: Of all the reviews for this hotel I cannot believe more people do not mention the train... An otherwise pleasant hotel stay is ruined every 15-45 minutes as a train goes thundering past. I actually wondered if it was an earthquake. Another minor point, parking near the lobby is a joke. Rent a scooter...

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: shock43
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for nearly 3 months in one of the suites in the summer of 2009 and had an excellent experience in spite of the hotel going through major renovations. The management and staff could not have been more helpful. We highly recommend this place for an extended stay. The location proofed perfect for us in the Seattle area.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable hotel for an extended stay, with a few caviats...”
Reviews.Author: Mardo
Reviews.Content: Spent almost the whole month of February and part of March in the Homewood Suites, Tukwila. I was pleased to get a Habitat-for-Humanity rate, which, as stated, promised $5 a night to that worthy organization. I booked a king fireplace suite and the room was spacious and clean (not spotless). Balcony overlooked the Green River, which truly isn't much to look at, but beats staring at a parking lot or busy street. The room was like a small apartment. Bed comfortable. Bathroom spacious and loved having toilet/shower in separate room. Having a mini kitchen was nice, even though the utensils and cooking supplies kind of limited. (Did not plan on making gourmet meals, so this was fine!) High-speed internet was nice, but not speedy quick. I did stream several movies on my computer without issue. Things to be aware of: Parking very limited for rooms towards the front of hotel by lobby. I had difficulty finding nearby parking even early in the evening. Sometimes I had to park on the opposite side of hotel. I worked very early and late shifts while I was in town and as a solo woman traveler I found walking through dark parking lots a little precarious. Most of the lots are lit fairly well, but still a little creepy. Train noise from nearby tracks is atrocious. Trains often made my whole room shake. The tracks get A LOT of use. I thought it was odd that the fireplace suite had a Duraflame log and wasn't a gas fireplace. Perhaps there is a rule about gas fireplaces in hotel rooms, I don't know. I do know that I was mighty disappointed to not be able to turn on the fireplace for 20 minutes on a cold, wet day to warm me up! Those Duraflames burn for awhile and I didn't want to fool with all that. There is a soccer complex next to the hotel which gets a lot of traffic. A lot of soccer players stay at this Homewood for tournaments and there can be a lot of teenagers - frequently unsupervised, it seemed to me - running around and making noise. Not the hotel's fault, of course, but be advised! Location kind of odd, but close enough to mall area without being too close. I had no problems with any front desk staff, in fact they were all very courteous. I would stay here again for business purposes, but for pleasure I'd find a great hotel downtown. Seattle is fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: BeccaBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Reception staff were rude. I asked for a late check out when i checked in and i was told they couldnt tell me if it woud be ok until the day i checked out. On the check out day i was told that i couldnt have a late check out because 2 other people were already getting late check outs and the housekeeping staff couldnt manage more than 2 late check outs. The supposed high speed internet ran a maxium of 14kb/s wich maybe high speed 4 a snail but not for the rest of us that actually need web pages loaded in less than an hour. Dont expect to get milk with your coffee in your room i was told if i wanted milk it would be a lengthy walk to a service station. The air conditioner in my room was crap to say the least, maximum heat was the same temperature as the coolest. Upon check in 2 of the 4 lamps in my room actually worked, the tv in the bedroom was not plugged in. Also while not entirely the fault of the hotel there were many noisy kids runing up and down hallways staircases and just generally making far to much noise. This hotel was by far the worst hotel i have ever stayed in, a very big diassapointment to the end of my trip, while i will deffinately be coming back to seattle i think its fair to say i will never be staying in another homewood suites, if i was mr hilton i would be ashamed to have my name attached to such crap.

Reviews.Title: “Wow.. Nobody cares !”
Reviews.Author: gurblish
Reviews.Content: I'll make this short and sweet. We stayed at this hotel for one night. The place was filthy. I told the person at the front desk. She didnt care. I wrote to her Manager... no reply... I guess she didnt care. I wrote to Hilton Worldwide, Guest Assistance Specialist in Carrolton, TX and was told that they needed 3 business days to get the info from the hotel manager. That was 21 days ago and I have heard nothing.I guess they got my money now, why waste any time dealing with me. Thats all.

Reviews.Title: “Very Quiet and Great Breakfast for the Kids”
Reviews.Author: propredicr
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in the evening and went up to a well furnished and clean room. Only issue was that it smelled like either new carpet/paint/or wood. Drove my allergies, nuts. Room had a small stove/microwave/refrigerator/sink. Very nice for families. We liked that the doors to the deck and windows opened for fresh air. The staff was very nice and I've had to contact them repeatedly to take care of an issue of double-billing, but, it was handled. Chris was excellent, as well as Greg. The breakfast was actually quite good with a good selection. Hot teas/coffee all day. They even serve dinner there, although it isn't very apparent. Just a tip to management to save food/money... get a sign up sheet, so you know approximately how many people will be coming down for dinner. It seemed to me that the night I went down, there was three times the amount of food necessary. The area is very convenient for tourists and you access the highway about 1 minute away. Overall, my family enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: smokie7
Reviews.Content: The staff was excellent and very attentive. They made you feel very special. I really appreciated that. I stayed in the bldg 100 which was just painted and the bathroom remodeled. They updated the beds last year and they are planning on getting new furniture. They also recently put in new flat panel tvs. The room was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms and good value”
Reviews.Author: elyette
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers more value than the ones closer to the airport and the van gets you there on time. Although service could be better and friendlier, I found the rooms large, clean and well appointed. They have a living room and kitchen. The hotel offers a free large hot breakfast for the same price as hotels nearer to the airport. This hotel is much quieter too. I especially liked the ability to check in and select my room the night before. I can't always leave work early to get a decent room.

Reviews.Title: “disappointment: poorer than average Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: freshLouisville
Reviews.Content: We're Hilton Honors members and our room was free. Still, we wouldn't have stayed here for more than one night. Why? Construction in the hotel, about which we were not informed in advance. Less than really clean room. Outdated furniture. We appreciated a ride to the airport in the early morning, which is the only reason we stayed. Check out this place carefully.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay under less than ideal conditions”
Reviews.Author: Catzwisker
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here to take in some Mariners baseball. The bus can be caught just down the street from the hotel, so it is very convenient. This not my regular place that I stay, But Homewood offered my a very good deal for the 4 nights if I paid in advance and reservation was not refundable. Sounded good enough for me considering the rate saved me a considerable amount. While the place was being painted, we had no problems getting around or being Inconvienced. Staff was courteous and helpful. Room was clean and comfortable. Staff also mentioned that they were in the process of updating the room furnishings also. This will only make the accomidations just a little better. Breakfast served in the morning is the usual that you find in most better hotels now. It would be nice if they served it a little later into the day. I like to sleep in, and missed breakfast the first morning. Will I stay here again? Because I can not afford expensive vacations, if the rate is good I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the suite life but watch out for the trains!”
Reviews.Author: Prodigal51
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Tukwila at a number of different hotels (Embassy, Doubletree, etc.) and really enjoy having the kitchen amenities that Homewood Suites provide. Having separate bed/living rooms is nice as well when my wife comes along. This hotel was average for a Homewood but is in a good location, close to work for me and right on the Green River walking path. The staff was extemely helpful and friendly and the room layout was typical for Homewood, but a little smaller than the one in downtown Seattle, for instance. The rooms could stand some upgrades to the bedding and televisions, but overall we enjoyed our stay except for the frequent trains rumbling by that shook the building. Recommend you get a room on the opposite side of the hotel to avoid this nuisance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CdnMtnGal
Reviews.Content: This is a standard Homewood Suites, which we chose strictly for its airport location, plus the fact that we are both Hilton Honors members. The room appeared to have been renovated, and was quite adequate, with king bed and separate living/dining area and kitchen. The breakfast buffet was also standard for Homewood Suites, and was a good start to our long day of travelling. The only negative is that styrofoam plates, bowls and cups are used, as well as plastic cutlery, which I found surprising in a "green" city such as Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: vballguy63
Reviews.Content: We were in Seattle for a soccer tournament and enjoyed this hotel. The room was a one bedroom suite, for the adults, and a two bedroom suite for the kids. It had a living area, kitchen and single bathroom. The only issue we had was there was not enough cooking utensils and euipemtn for meal preparation, but when we needed more, the kitchen staff was more than helpful. The kitchen had a stove, no oven and a microwave, dishwasher, sink. it would be adeuqate to prepare meals for a family, but in our case we used several rooms due to the soccer team. There was adequate room to move around, the tv's were new and flatscreen, the bedding was newer and the hotel was what you would expect from a Homewood. The entry area led straight to the kitchen and then to the right was the living area. The back right was where the bedroom and bathroom were located. The breakfasts included toast, cereal, fruit, drink, and the food itself varied daily. One day it was ham and another biscuits and gravy. As a frequent traveller, the importance of a nice breakfast is valuable, and especially with a bunch of hungry soccer players. I also enjoyed the cofffe and availability of drinks throughout the day. This facility is very close to the Sounders complex and we walked there. We took the bus to downtown and that also was convenient abeit a small walk of maybe .3 miles. The bus was convenient and we did nto have to change buses at all. A very nice hotel that we would not hesitate to stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Roook
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Homewood Suites near Southcenter Mall on 3/20/09. The price was under $100 per night with taxes, by booking 3 days in advance. We liked the fact that it is right behind the Family Fun Center in Tukwila, near the Southcenter Mall, close to the Emerald Downs Horse Track, and 20 minutes from Muckleshoot Casino. We were pretty impressed with the room. It had a microwave, full size fridge, coffee pot, stovetop, and all of the utensils and flatware that you would need. The room also had a couch with a hide-a-bed, coffee table, and a chair with ottoman. The room had a great Hilton comfort bed with tons of fluffy, soft pillows. It also had a very nice alarm clock that I think you could plug your Ipod into. The bathroom was also topnotch, with marble and tile. Overall we really liked the room but could see some issues staying on the East end of the property, where trains go right next to the property several times a day. We heard one train go by and were glad that we were not at that end of the facility. The room was pretty clean except for some fuzzy's on the comforter cover. The hallways and elevator area were not very clean and looked like they had been neglected for a week or so. The free breakfast was great. They had one of those waffle makers, french toast, bagels, eggs, biscuits and gravy, yogurt, cereal, oatmeal, etc. We were pretty surprised at the variety. They also had milk, soda, juice and coffee. Also, they had USA Today right there to grab while you ate. We also looked into the business center and it was very nice. It had a couple computers, ample desk space for several people, and printers. I didn't use the wireless at the hotel. The hotel also offers an evening beverage reception Monday - Thursday, but we were there Fri - Saturday. Overall, I would definitely stay here again. The location is top notch for SeaTac, shopping, gambling, popping over to Seattle, running up to BellSquare, whatever. We usually stay at Embassy Suites, but I chose Homewood due to the good TripAdvisor reviews. We were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pepper21
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to the Seattle area. In the suburbs but only a ten minute drive to downtown Seattle. Nice rooms, free breakfast, easy in/out. Stayed here in 2004 and again in 2007 for a week at a time. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “ok place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dpatterson20
Reviews.Content: For the price this hotel is a good choice. Not only are they full suites with kitchen equipment they also serve a free breakfast and dinner. In addition to dinner they have beer and wine that flows freely. The dinner and breakfast are nothing to write home about but they are good and fill you up. The rooms are average, but not out of date and have normal accommodations for the price. I had numerous problems with the internet and there is only wireless internet in the lobby, the rooms have Ethernet cables. The staff was ok but did not go out of their way to make you feel happy and make sure everything was going well with your stay. The location of the hotel is excellent as long as you don’t have to travel to downtown in rush hour. If there is no traffic you can make it to downtown in less than 15 minutes. This hotel is located about 5 minutes away from Boeing field and Boeing Reaton.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: jbutters
Reviews.Content: I was in town for an interview and the company booked the hotel. It was a very good experience. Their shuttle came and picked me up, took me to grab some food, back to the hotel and then out to the company for the interview and back again. All of the staff were extremely nice. I had a double room with a full kitchen. They have a full complimentary breakfast in the morning and during the week they have themed dinners that are also complimentary. You're definitely getting a good amount for your buck. I was even late to the dinner and one of the workers went back to the kitchen and got me some food anyway. I have nothing but good things to say about the staff and hotel. I'd stay again and probably will this month when I relocate to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: twasbrillig4
Reviews.Content: With one notable exception, all my stays at Homewood Suites have been very good and as expected. This one was also good. We had a suite with king bed and everything was clean and in good condition. There were some fake red flowers on the coffee table which provided a splash of colour. I booked this one night stay 11 months in advance and got a great rate of $99 plus tax for the night. It was considerably more expensive later. The only slight negative for us was we had travelled from the UK on a Saturday and the buffet breakfast was not served until 7 am on Sunday. As we'd been up since 3 am thanks to the time difference, we went to the closest 24-hour Wal-Mart and stocked up on water, snacks etc for the rest of our trip. The buffet was very good and as well as all the usual items, there were breakfast burritos (good), scrambled egg and a waffle iron was provided to make your own with the batter provided. There was also a separate food section with what appeared to be Japanese food, along with chopsticks. The surrounding area to this Homewood Suites was quite pleasant. A good place to start a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: dogsareforlife
Reviews.Content: I think the reviewer below has possibly confused this hotel with another one???? There is ample parking, all of it safe and near the suites. It's near some offices (definitely NOT industrial) but there is no 'kerb side parking' and the hotel car park seemed very safe and secure - it was also well lit. We had no problems with our rental car. The rooms are serviced well each day - they are clean and modern and very well appointed - quite stylish really. The towels and linens were good quality, the bed comfortable and the bathroom very nice (good shower in our suite). There was also a very large separate kitchen with free popcorn and water. Our suite was number 227 - it overlooked a nice walking/cycle path on the Green River. It was easy to walk to the nearby mall too. Breakfast was fine - it was a busy time but the place remained clean and tidy - the staff were nice and helpful. Food was typical HS & the tea and coffee were excellent. In the evening, there was a fantastic salad bar along with chicken burgers on one night (other half liked his, I just had salad) and spaghetti the next - both reasonable and eaten in a nice environment. This is both a good airport hotel AND an excellent choice for touring given it's close proximity to the freeways. I'd definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Ruby1239
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one night because we wanted to be close to the airport for our morning flight the next day. We arrived around 3:00 pm. My daughters wanted to shop at the Southcenter Mall and the shuttle driver drove us there and picked us up at a prearranged time. When we returned, we enjoyed the complimentary evening snack which was cream of broccoli and cheese soup and salad which were both decent. One of my daughter's is a very picky eater (doesn't like soup or salad) but my husband found a fast food restaurant close by. In the morning we enjoyed the complimentary continental breakfast. Our daughters especially enjoyed the waffles which they could make themselves. Some of the food was not great, such as the eggs, sausage and canned (yuk) fruit., There was yogurt, muffins, oatmeal (didn't try) and toast as well, enough to sustain us for our flight home. The room was nicely decorated. We booked a one bedroom suite. It came with a small kitchenette which encluded a full size fridge, microwave and even a dishwasher. We felt it would have been comfortable enough for a few days stay.

Reviews.Title: “A very Nice Place for a Week's Stay...”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonWeatherman
Reviews.Content: Do to a future Job Transfer, my family and I combined a House Hunting trip and Vacation into one and stayed at the SeaTac Homewood suites for a week from Mar 14-21. Although the hotel appears very plain from outside, we found upon entering, a large, well appointed and very comfortable Lobby/Great Room with two fireplaces. (This area also doubles as the breakfast and cocktail area) The two bedroom-two bath suite was very roomy and comfortable for 6 adults and one small dog. With a fully equip kitchen, this made for an ideal central point to explore the Seattle Area. Our suite overlooked the Green River and the river walkway was perfect for walking the dog in the morning. Although trains could be heard they were not bothersome and added a light country feel to the atmosphere. MT route 150 (METRO BUS) which stops less than a 1/8 of mile from the hotel is a direct (no transfers) to downtown Seattle with stops 2 or 3 blocks from both Pike's Public Market and the Space Needle. It saved on gas and traffic headaches. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous and the business room with two Internet ready PC's was very convenient along with the 24hr self serve laundry, which we all used. As for the reports of numerous vehicle break-ins, the hotel has a few office buildings and a large park in the immediate area which would account for these. We parked all the way in the back of the property and did not have any problems. My wife and I will be returning in late July or early August and most likely be staying here for a week or two until our new home is ready.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: AGTripper
Reviews.Content: We, a party of 3, enjoyed staying at this hotel for 4 nights between Christmas and New Year. We did not experience car break-in. The hotel is clean and efficient. Great breakfast bar, as mentioned by many, and by far the best accommodation I have had in Seattle, for my tight budget. A hint to others: For $10 more, choose a suite with a fireplace - the suite is much roomier and most important, has a bathroom that's outside of the bedroom. Some minor dings: train noise, drafty first-floor room. I thank Billy and one of his colleagues for accommodating our request to switch from a smaller suite: it made all the difference. Also, my luggage did not arrive the first night and I was estatic to find it at the front desk first thing in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and exceptional value for Seattle Airport area”
Reviews.Author: Marliroo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is closer to the South Mall than the airport, but they have a free shuttle which picks you up and drops off, so the extra 5 minute drive is really irrelevant. We do have to wait an extra 10-15 minutes for the pickup, but it is really worth it. We have stayed here 4 times recently and every time has been great. Each room is a suite with a living area, fold out couch, TV and small kitchen and a large bedroom with beautiful bathroom. This makes it a great value if traveling with kids especially with their free breakfast. There is a second TV in the bedroom. Breakfast is buffet style with make-your-own waffles, fruits, cereals, yogurts, muffins, toast, scrambled eggs and meat and fresh juices. There is a fireplace and big-screen TV in the lobby which looks out on the pool and hot-tub (in a pretty little gazebo). In the evening there are soft drinks in the breakfast area and on certain days there is a free happy hour with snacks, but we have not been there for that. The staff is really friendly and professional and the maid service has turned towel-folding into an origami artform. Rooms are immaculately clean and very quiet. Their soaps and shampoos are first class and we always look forward to popping the complimentary pop-corn in the microwave. Trying to find this place on your own is tricky, it cannot be seen from the main roads, so call for directions or use a map.

Reviews.Title: “Car Break-ins at the Homewood Suites - Tukwila, Washington”
Reviews.Author: Montana-aa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were meeting family from overseas in Tukwila, Washington for X-mas. On our second night at the hotel, our truck was broken into and various items from our vehicle were taken. When the police arrived, they informed us that this hotel averages 2 break-ins a week and that he was here two nights before investigating a break-in only two parking spaces where our vehicle was parked. 2 break-ins a week equals 112 break-ins a year -- obviously our break-in is not an isolated incident. This hotel is very aware of the break-in probelms that occur in their parking lot, but have not make any steps in which to thwart off potential break-ins, such as security cameras, fences/gates around their property that admit only registered guests with keys or on-site security officers. It is very upsetting to know that break-ins occur on a fairly regular basis at this hotel and yet the hotel itself has done nothing to prevent such incidents. This incident cost me approximately $600 for the damange to my vehicle and a loss of over $200 worth of items removed from my truck. I do not recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Great Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and found the this Homewood Suites absolutely great. The staff went the extra mile to ensure comfort of their guests. I especially liked the great breakfasts and evening Manager's dinners (Monday thru Thursday). Clean, quiet, roomy, and well maintained. Also great location near jogging/bike path. My number one choice for Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: monro
Reviews.Content: The Homewood was a very nice surprise. The room was spacious and very clean. The free Evening meal was tasty and the breakast very good as well. I booked well in advance and received a great rate around $70. Overall, the Homewood was a great experience and I would definitely stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Homewood Suites Seattle - Tacoma Airport / Tukwila
HotelInfo.Address: 6955 Fort Dent Way, Seattle, WA 98188
